issue.title: Provisioning dashboard with alert rules should create alerts
issue.body:
Provisioning of a dashboard that has alert rule(s) fails with an invalid alert data error. Reported in #11227

Similar, when creating a new dashboard that has alert rule(s) it should be possible to save that without failure with invalid alert data error.

comment.body: @tettaji awesome! please sign the CLA so we can merge this :)

issue.title: [bug] prometheus datasource multi-value template variable expand incorrect
issue.body:
Please include this information:
- What Grafana version are you using?
   4.6.3
- What datasource are you using?
  prometheus 2.0
- What OS are you running grafana on?
  ubuntu 16.04
- What did you do?
  plot multiple line with `  by (service)`
- What was the expected result?
   plot multiple line
- What happened instead?
   plot only the first 
- If related to metric query / data viz:
  `sum(rpc_durations_seconds{service=~'$serviceName'}) by (service)` only draw one line, I already selected `normal and uniform`, which is wrong  
   query inspector result is, which replace the $serviceName as `normal` instead of `(normal|uniform)` as document described
```
xhrStatus:"complete"
request:Object
method:"GET"
url:"http://kudu:9090/api/v1/query_range?query=sum(rpc_durations_seconds%7Bservice%3D~'normal'%7D)%20by%20(service)&start=1515404291&end=1515490631&step=600"
```

  - `sum(rpc_durations_seconds{service=~'normal|uniform'}) by (service)` draw two line correctly
 
from https://community.grafana.com/t/single-graph-with-multiple-plots-for-multi-value-template-variable/856 

I found some hint.
 I tried the play.grafana.com, which is correct. So I guess it is a new bug introduced in newer version.

Thanks!

Jiming

pull_request.title: dashboard: allow alerts to be saved for new/provisioned dashboards
pull_request.body:
This changes the logic for the alert validation in the extractor. Validation
is executed twice, once before attempting to save the alerts and once after
saving the dashboard while saving the alerts to the db. The first validation
will not require that the alert has a dashboard id which allows new dashboards
with alerts to be saved.

Fixes #11247

issue.title: Postgres datasource provisioning problems
issue.body:
### What Grafana version are you using?
5.0.3
### What datasource are you using?
Postgres

### What OS are you running grafana on?
Docker container 

### What did you do?
Created a datasources.yml file with the following content: 

``` 
# list of datasources that should be deleted from the database
delete_datasources:

# list of datasources to insert/update depending
# whats available in the datbase
datasources:
- name: pg-dashboard
  type: postgres
  access: proxy
  url: postgres:5432
  password: "password"
  user: "grafanareader"
  database: "dashboard"
  basicAuth: false
  is_default: true
  editable: true
  json_data:
    ssl_mode: "disable"
```

The problem is the sslMode setting - which is not working. 

I have also tried this with : 
```
  json_data:
    ssl_mode: "disable"
``` 

and 

``` 
  jsonData:
    sslMode: "disable"
```  

None of which seem to work. 

What is the correct syntax? 

### What was the expected result?
Fully provisoned postgres datasource

### What happened instead?
ssl mode is set to `require`- which means I have to manually change the setting on a new system before things work.

comment.body:
Hmm - I am seeing this error in the log file for the docker container: 

```
[Deprecated] the datasource provisioning config is outdated. please upgrade" logger=provisioning.datasources filename=/etc/grafana/provisioning/datasources/datasource.yml
```

So there must be something wrong with the provisioning file.

[![CLA assistant check](https://cla-assistant.io/pull/badge/not_signed)](https://cla-assistant.io/grafana/grafana?pullRequest=11410)
Thank you for your submission, we really appreciate it. Like many open source projects, we ask that you sign our [Contributor License Agreement](https://cla-assistant.io/grafana/grafana?pullRequest=11410) before we can accept your contribution.
**Patrick Schuster** seems not to be a GitHub user. You need a GitHub account to be able to sign the CLA. If you have already a GitHub account, please [add the email address used for this commit to your account](https://help.github.com/articles/why-are-my-commits-linked-to-the-wrong-user/#commits-are-not-linked-to-any-user).
You have signed the CLA already but the status is still pending? Let us [recheck](https://cla-assistant.io/check/grafana/grafana?pullRequest=11410) it.

issue.title: Postgres datasource provisioning problems
issue.body:
### What Grafana version are you using?
5.0.3
### What datasource are you using?
Postgres

### What OS are you running grafana on?
Docker container 

### What did you do?
Created a datasources.yml file with the following content: 

``` 
# list of datasources that should be deleted from the database
delete_datasources:

# list of datasources to insert/update depending
# whats available in the datbase
datasources:
- name: pg-dashboard
  type: postgres
  access: proxy
  url: postgres:5432
  password: "password"
  user: "grafanareader"
  database: "dashboard"
  basicAuth: false
  is_default: true
  editable: true
  json_data:
    ssl_mode: "disable"
```

The problem is the sslMode setting - which is not working. 

I have also tried this with : 
```
  json_data:
    ssl_mode: "disable"
``` 

and 

``` 
  jsonData:
    sslMode: "disable"
```  

None of which seem to work. 

What is the correct syntax? 

### What was the expected result?
Fully provisoned postgres datasource

### What happened instead?
ssl mode is set to `require`- which means I have to manually change the setting on a new system before things work.

comment.body: I think I have tried all possible combinations here and just cannot get it to work. May have to resort to posting json data for now.

issue.title: Column Support

milestone.title: 5.0.0-alpha1
milestone.description: MVP for demo builds and early feedback.

issue.body: I would be really nice to have support for the "column" panel type in Kibana :)

comment.body: +1 for a grid/column system. This would be particularly helpful for using text panels as titles and centring them neatly

issue.title: Installing & enabling plugins through provisioning
issue.body:
It's currently possible to [provision](http://docs.grafana.org/administration/provisioning/) datasources and dashboards but not plugins. When using the Docker container this is solved to some extent by being able to provision/install plugins using an env variable. 

This leaves app plugins without provisioning as they need to be enabled after they have been installed. It also leaves installs without docker without provisioning support.

### Proposal:
- extend provisioning to support plugins
- extend provisioning to support app plugins

issue.title: [bug] prometheus datasource multi-value template variable expand incorrect
issue.body:
Please include this information:
- What Grafana version are you using?
   4.6.3
- What datasource are you using?
  prometheus 2.0
- What OS are you running grafana on?
  ubuntu 16.04
- What did you do?
  plot multiple line with `  by (service)`
- What was the expected result?
   plot multiple line
- What happened instead?
   plot only the first 
- If related to metric query / data viz:
  `sum(rpc_durations_seconds{service=~'$serviceName'}) by (service)` only draw one line, I already selected `normal and uniform`, which is wrong  
   query inspector result is, which replace the $serviceName as `normal` instead of `(normal|uniform)` as document described
```
xhrStatus:"complete"
request:Object
method:"GET"
url:"http://kudu:9090/api/v1/query_range?query=sum(rpc_durations_seconds%7Bservice%3D~'normal'%7D)%20by%20(service)&start=1515404291&end=1515490631&step=600"
```

  - `sum(rpc_durations_seconds{service=~'normal|uniform'}) by (service)` draw two line correctly
 
from https://community.grafana.com/t/single-graph-with-multiple-plots-for-multi-value-template-variable/856 

I found some hint.
 I tried the play.grafana.com, which is correct. So I guess it is a new bug introduced in newer version.

Thanks!

Jiming

comment.body:
Nope, after some mucking about, I figured out what the issue was in my case (maybe this help @jiming as well).

I entered `.*` as the "Custom All value", which somehow caused only the first value from the template variable to be used. If I leave the field blank, the query is correctly expanded to `query{key=~"something|otherthing"}`.

I do find this behaviour a bit odd though; if leaving the field empty is the correct way to expand variables like this, I would expect it to also query with whatever is entered in that field, i.e. `key=~".*"`.

Maybe it would be a good idea to have this documented in http://docs.grafana.org/reference/templating/#formating-multiple-values ?
